Chemical Engineering.1: Apply knowledge of mathematics, science, and engineering.
Chemical Engineering.2: Design and conduct experiments, as well as to analyze and interpret data.
Chemical Engineering.3: Design a system, component, or process to meet desired needs within realistic constraints such as economic, environmental, social, political, ethical, health and safety, manufacturability, and sustainability.
Chemical Engineering.5: Identify, formulate, and solve engineering problems.
Chemical Engineering.8: Understand the impact of engineering solutions in a global, economic, environmental, and societal context.
Chemical Engineering.9: Recognize the need for, and an ability to engage in life-long learning.
Chemical Engineering.10: Have a knowledge of contemporary issues.
Chemical Engineering.11: Use the techniques, skills, and modern engineering tools necessary for engineering practice.
Chemical Engineering.notes: The Department of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering bases its learning outcomes on the prescribed ABET accreditation student outcomes, also referred to as the a-through-k criteria.
